35.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
35.str2: To murder, kill. From phoneus; to be a murderer.
Meanwhile, afterwards, between. From meta and a form of sun; betwixt; as adjective, intervening, or adjoining.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A temple, a shrine, that part of the temple where God himself resides. From a primary naio; a fane, shrine, temple.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An altar (for sacrifice). From a derivative of thusia; a place of sacrifice, i.e. An altar.

36.str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

36.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
36.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

36.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
36.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

36.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
36.str2: To have come, be present, have arrived. A primary verb; to arrive, i.e. Be present.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.

37.str2: Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

37.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Vocative Feminine Singular
37.str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
And, even, also, namely.

37.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Vocative Feminine Singular
37.str2: To stone, cast stones (at), kill by stoning. From a compound of lithos and ballo; to throw stones, i.e. Lapidate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

37.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
37.str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

37.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
How often, how many times. Multiplicative from posos; how many times.

37.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
37.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
To collect, gather together, assemble. From epi and sunago; to collect upon the same place.

37.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
37.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
From the same as trope; a turn, i.e. mode or style; figuratively, deportment or character.
A bird, fowl, hen. Probably from a prolonged form of the base of oros; a bird, i.e., a hen.

37.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: To collect, gather together, assemble. From epi and sunago; to collect upon the same place.

37.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A nestling, the young of birds. Diminutive of neossos; a birdling.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A wing, pinion. From a derivative of petomai; a wing.
And, even, also, namely.

37.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

38.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
38.str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
38.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

38.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
38.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

39.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

39.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
39.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

39.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
39.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
39.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

39.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
39.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
39.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

39.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
39.str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

39.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular

39.str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
